items.title: First Tick: Top 10 global cues for todayâ€™s trade
items.description: The GIFT Nifty is indicating a gap-down start for the day.

items.title: Asia tracks worst US selloff since August crash
items.description: Asian stocks slumped following Wall Street's worst day since August 5, led by a 3% drop in Japanâ€™s Nikkei 225. Weak US manufacturing data, plunging oil prices, and Nvidiaâ€™s record 9.5% loss fueled concerns over global economic health.

items.title: Wall Street drops on September worries, upcoming data
items.description: All major indexes, including the S&P 500, Nasdaq, and Dow, posted their worst daily losses since early August as manufacturing data highlighted ongoing economic weakness, dragging down key sectors.

items.title: Stock Radar: AU SFB, GIC, GSK Pharma, Godfrey Phillips, Exicom, Ecos India Mobility in focus on Wednesday
items.description: Stocks like Mankind Pharma, Indian Energy Exchange, NHPC, BGR Energy Systems, PDS, Jindal Stainless, and Medi Assist Healthcare Services will also be in focus on September 4.

items.title: DAC greenlights Rs 1.44 lakh crore procurements; HAL, Mazagon Dock, other defence stocks in focus
items.description: Defence stocks, including HAL and Mazagon Dock are in focus after the Defence Acquisition Council (DAC) approved major procurement projects worth Rs 1.44 lakh crore for the Armed Forces.

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: GIFT Nifty indicates a gap-down start; US, Asian markets drag
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: US stocks slumped on Tuesday, at the start of one of the market's historically worst months, ahead of data likely to influence how much the Federal Reserve will lower interest rates. The benchmark S&P 500 index, Nasdaq Composite Index and the Dow Jones Industrial Average recorded their biggest daily percentage declines since early August. Nine out of 11 S&P 500 sectors fell, led by declines in technology, energy, communication services and materials.

items.title: Morgan Stanley bullish on large private banks vs others amid attractive valuations
items.description: Among the large private banks, ICICI Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank, and Axis Bank remain Morgan Stanley's top picks, albeit with marginal target cuts

items.title: GIC Re shares in focus as govt to divest 6.8% stake in PSU insurer via OFS
items.description: GIC Re shares are in focus as the government launches a nearly 7 percent stake divestment via OFS on September 4 and 5, with a floor price of Rs 395 per share.

items.title: Morgan Stanley upgrades PI Industries but Aarti Industries gets a downgrade
items.description: Morgan Stanley has raised price targets for some chemical stocks but also warned that the sector's earnings have not yet been fully de-risked.

items.title: Bajaj Finance can re-rate if subsidiary Bajaj Housing Finance delivers bumper listing: Macquarie
items.description: Bajaj Housing Finance, set to open its IPO on September 9, has established a price band of Rs 66-70 per share

items.title: Something feels not quite right in the mid-cap rally
items.description: A significant portion of the rally in mid-caps can be attributed to the substantial inflows of mid-cap, small-cap, and sectoral/thematic funds. Mid-cap funds, which attracted just Rs 500 crore in 2020, saw inflows of Rs 1,600 crore in July 2024 alone and a total of Rs 22,900 crore in 2023

items.title: Exicom Tele stock slumps 4.5% after Rakesh Jhunjhunwala entity trims stake
items.description: The Rakesh Jhunjhunwala entity--RARE Enterprises, sold 15.85 lakh shares or a 1.3 percent stake in Exicom Tele Systems, valued at Rs 55.25 crore.

items.title: AU Small Finance Bank gains as it applies to RBI for transition to a universal bank
items.description: Applicants must have a minimum net worth of Rs 1,000 crore, scheduled status, and a satisfactory track record of at least five years for universal bank status

items.title: MOIL stock rises as PSU achieves best-ever August production of 1.24 lakh tonnes
items.description: MOIL shares rose on September 4 after reporting its best-ever best-ever August production of 1.24 lakh tonnes. The PSU operates its underground and opencast mines located in Maharashtra and Madhya Pradesh.

items.title: RR Kabel shares edge higher as Citi recommends 'buy' with a hiked target price
items.description: Citi believes that the wires and cables industry is benefiting from strong structural tailwinds, driven by infrastructure capex, PLI schemes, and a real estate upcycle in India, Citi added.

items.title: Chart of the day | IPO investors seek quick returns
items.description: If institutional investors, equipped with extensive research capabilities and resources, behave similarly to retail investors and sell their IPO holdings rapidly, are they truly maximising the potential of their investments?

items.title: Home First Finance: Gearing up for the next milestone
items.description: Technology, at the heart of strategic initiatives, will drive growth and profitability

items.title: Havells India shares gain marginally as it starts commercial production at new facility
items.description: Havells India Share Price | The production through expansion at Tumakuru is expected to commence by September 2026.

items.title: Mankind Pharma shares gain as it transfers OTC biz undertaking to subsidiary
items.description: Mankind Pharma Share Price | The completion of this transaction is subject to various pre-conditions and terms specified in the BTA.

items.title: Agri Picks Report September 04, 2024: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit, The Cotton Association of India today said it has retained the country's production estimate for 2023-24 (Oct-Sep) at 31.8 mln bales (1 bale = 170 kg).

items.title: IPO fund raising soars to 27-month high in August
items.description: As many as 10 firms collectively raised Rs 17,047.52 crore through IPOs in August, marking the largest primary market fundraising since May 2022.

items.title: Shares of AU Small Finance rise as lender applies for universal banking licence
items.description: AU Small Finance Bank has applied to the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) for voluntary transition from a Small Finance Bank to a Universal Bank.

items.title: Jubilant Ingrevia spurts 6% on Equirus Capital target upgrade, sees 25% upside potential
items.description: Jubilant Ingrevia's target upgrade came after global specialty maker Vertellus shut Pyridine production in the US, a solvent primarily used for paint, rubber, pharma, and other products

items.title: Crude price drops: OMC and paint stocks rejoice, ONGC and Oil India slip into red
items.description: The fall in Brent crude prices is a double-edged sword in the stock market, benefiting some sectors while hurting others.

items.title: Metro Brands: Looking forward to a strong second half
items.description: Metro Brands Limited is expected to significantly strengthen its presence in the S&A (sports and athleisure) category, with tie-ups/acquisitions. This will provide the next leg of growth.

items.title: Aether Industries' shares soar on heavy volumes
items.description: Aether Industries shares soared on September 4 amid a surge in trading volume, with around 3 lakh shares changing hands.

items.title: Minda Corp stock gains on signing technology licensing agreement with Chinaâ€™s Sanco
items.description: Minda Corporation shares rose after the company announced a technology licensing agreement with China's Sanco Connecting Technology to enhance its EV product offerings.

items.title: Buy CEAT; target of Rs 3650: Emkay Global Financial
items.description: Emkay Global Financial is bullish on CEAT has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 3650 in its research report dated September 03, 2024.

items.title: Buy IndusInd Bank; target of Rs 1750: Sharekhan
items.description: Sharekhan is bullish on IndusInd Bank has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 1750 in its research report dated September 03, 2024.

items.title: Motilal Oswal AMC looks at 'high conviction investing' to generate alpha
items.description: The management of the mutual fund entity aims to grow the company at a rate of more than 25 percent to double its market share at a time when the industry is growing in the range of 10-15 percent.

items.title: Japanese stocks tumble on tech selloff, US recession worries
items.description: Japanese stocks suffered their steepest decline since the onset of a bear market a month ago, driven by a dismal US manufacturing report and a global tech selloff. The Nikkei 225 fell 4.2%, with chipmakers like Disco Corp. leading losses after Nvidia Corp.'s subpoena news dampened sentiment.

items.title: Accumulate Torrent Power; target of Rs 1893: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: Geojit Financial Services recommended accumulate rating on Torrent Power with a target price of Rs 1893 in its research report dated September 03, 2024.

items.title: Nifty PE surges past 10-yr avg as liquidity fuels rally; Macquarie bets on banks, autos
items.description: Nifty PE surges above the 10-year average as liquidity drives markets higher. Macquarie favours banks, autos, and materials while cautioning against staples and utilities.

items.title: Global cues drag indices lower; Bank Nifty could expire range bound if 51,250 level holds
items.description: Options data shows the highest put writing for Nifty at 25,000, with 24,900 levels acting as a crucial support zone

items.title: Buy Godrej Consumer Products; target of Rs 1700: Motilal Oswal
items.description: Motilal Oswal is bullish on Godrej Consumer Products recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 1700 in its research report dated September 03, 2024.

items.title: Sell Thermax; target of Rs 3968: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: Geojit Financial Services is bearish on Thermax has recommended sell rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 3968 in its research report dated September 04, 2024.

items.title: BEML stock soars 7% on heavy volumes after DAC clears acquisitions worth Rs 1.45 lakh crore
items.description: BEML share price surged on September 4 after the DAC approved Rs 1.4 lakh crore in defence procurements, driving heavy trading volumes on BSE and NSE.

items.title: Sona BLW in talks to acquire rail engg biz of Escorts Kubota, likely to launch Rs 2,000-cr QIP: CNBC-TV18
items.description: To fund the acquisition, Sona BLW is soon looking to launch a Rs 2,000 crore Qualified Institutional Placement, the report added.

items.title: Taking Stock: Bears back in action; Nifty below 25,200, Sensex down 203 pts
items.description: On the sectoral front, FMCG, realty and pharma gained 0.5 percent each, while auto, bank, energy, IT, metal were down 0.4-1 percent.

items.title: Live: Nifty's 14-Day Gaining Spree Halts| OMCs, Paint Stocks Gain As Crude Cools| Closing Bell
items.description: Nifty snaps 14-day record run but ends off lows; recovers nearly 100 points from day's low. Mid & small-caps stage a good rebound from lows. India VIX jumps over 4%; Breadth favours losers. PSU banks top losers followed by IT & metals. FMCG & pharma to the rescue again. Catch Nandita Khemka and Yatin Mota as they discuss stocks on their radar including Pipe Cos and Jubliant Ingrevia.

items.title: Gainers & losers: Stocks and sectors that moved the most on September 4
items.description: The Sensex and Nifty recovered from the day's lows to end the session with only minor losses. By the final hour of trading, five of the 13 major sectoral indices had bounced back.

items.title: Boss Packaging SME IPO: 64 employees, one dilapidated office and 135x subscription!
items.description: With an issue size of just over Rs 8 crore, the company, supplying machines for packaging, labelling, capping, and filling, received bids worth a whopping Rs 1,073 crore.

items.title: Select set of institutional investors gobble up anchor portion of SME IPOs
items.description: The anchor allocation in SME IPOs appears to have become a club of select set of institutional investors as data shows that a few handful of investors are being allocated shares in most of the public issues in the segment dedicated for small and medium enterprises (SMEs).

items.title: Block Deals: Infinity Direct Holdings sells 13.39 lakh shares of Camlin Fine Sciences
items.description: Dodona Holdings Limited sold 1.21 lakh shares (0.03 percent stake) of Trent Ltd at Rs 6,966 per share. Siddhartha Yog was the buyer.
